intro: Sicyos palmatus, commonly known as the giant dayflower, is a member of the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial vine characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Sicyos palmatus is native to the tropical regions of the Americas and thrives in warm, humid climates. Its rapid growth and striking foliage make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
